reviewText:
If you gonna make a mobile port game, don't forget that WE CAN'T BUY ANYTHING IN GAME!

Seriously, I bought a new ship for 40 Red Crystals, and that was too expensive already, considering that We drop like 2~3 crystals per stage, and I already started with 30. But after one single stage my ship got damaged, and I had to wait 20 MINUTES for life regen!!! Or pay 1 crystal (which I didn't have) for quick regen. Great game: play 2 minutes, wait 20 for another round!

And you also can't select/confirm options with the controller. I'm using Xbox 360 controller and I got to use mouse to click on boxes that appear in game. The controller only serves to maneuver the ship left and right while you're racing".


Dont buy it

reviewText:
I give a non-recommendation for two things, firstly, completely broken games, and secondly, games that I find mediocre and/or flawed, Sky To Fly: Faster Than Wind falls into the later. It’s a running game set in a steampunk universe, and while it’s in Early Access I feel the game has shown its original roots and developer intentions.

Review - https://youtu.be/7j0p_KE1aVU

I’ll address the elephant in the room; yes it’s a mobile port. This is shown through the use of a premium currency and though it is obtainable in game it is extremely slow. Also the premium currency ships and crew members are superior to the ‘f2p’ options in every single way. It bares its ugly teeth when you have to wait 20 MINUTES! for a ship to recover its HP after a mission, but don’t worry, with some premium currency we’ll have ‘er up and runnin’ in no time!

Usual runner stuff applies, go through a level, pick up coins, dodge terrain and enemies, and use premium currency to give yourself a boost for that level. Unlike most running games though the controls are slow and stiff, and there is no feeling of speed. Your control options are either left or right and the use of an ‘active’ ability, this is less than your usual smart phone runner. Also the sense of difficulty is non-existent due to the slow gameplay and if you run into any difficulty it’s due to the limitation of the controls and generally poorly designed enemies, but if you do struggle you can spend that good ol’ premium currency and revive yourself!

Sky To Fly: Faster Than Wind is an example of a game that is extremely flawed for the PC space. While it may boasts great graphics and story mode for a smart phone game, this is the PC and the standards are different. The laziness shown through the keeping of premium currency and all the ‘features’ it entails is just something you can’t ignore, and turns something that could be a somewhat enjoyable experience sour.

Edit: The game is now fully released and none of the issues have been addressed. The points in the review still hold true.

reviewText:
I also covered this game on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_VvjDmdHNAA

I am not normally a fan of mobile ports to the PC but Sky to Fly really surprised me. It's kind of like a runner except it's mission based as opposed to endless and it has a story, though it's pretty threadbare and also poorly translated.

The game play is done with only two keys (with a third later on) and largely involves dodging things as you get from place to place to complete story and side missions. You collect two different forms of currency along the way, which can be used to acquire better crew members with different traits, as well as upgrade your ship. It's not complex or difficult in the slightest but it has a very relaxes, zen feel. The art style is superb and conveys the unique world of floating islands very nicely and it's accompanied with very nice, chill music. This isn't a game you play for challenge or a massive sense of accomplishment, it's just relaxing fun.

This is a game that clearly has free-to-play roots from mobile as some mechanics like timers are still in this (though made so fast, they're utterly pointless) but there are no in-game purchases whatsoever and you're given plenty of currency and can finish the entire 3-4 hour adventure in one sitting if you want. Many formerly free-to-play mobile games that port to PC either leave the microtransactions in or jack up the price to an absurd level to avoid them. Sky to Fly only costs $4 and has no microtransactions. For me, the experience was an absolute steal at that price.

If you want something challenging or hardcore"
date: you're not going to find that with Sky to Fly but as someone who does love hardcore games
recommended: this was a nice little diversion when I just wanted to check out and chill for a while. You can't go wrong for the price in my opinion."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Players should fly away from this game (At least for the time being)!
Disclaimer: I privately recieved a review key for the intentions of critiquing this game, and hence did not have to buy the game myself.

Video Review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rxTMe737hj4

There's a few aspects of the game that are enjoyable, but are just outnumbered by the number of things wrong with the game, things that I highly doubt an extended period of Early Access will fix:

Positives:
-Good sound effects & music
-Unique, interesting art style
-The game's overall light, casual tone

Negatives:
-Intrusive, downright lazy attempts at storytelling
-Unpolished, half-hearted attempts at introducing RPG elements
-Repetitive gameplay
-No replay value

Overall Grade:
3/10

I deleted my original review, after a long read through it I felt immature myself.  Yet I found a lot of it very true, and after investigating a lot of it I decided I should re do it.  My original thoughts remain; the game itself is appaulingly bad for a game you have to pay for.  But here I want to focus more on something else than the actual game; what it originally was.

But first review about what it currently is, and isn't
What it is:
A Runner" game that's currently free on the Google Play Marketplace.  Here's the link so you don't waste money on this version and can try it out on an emulator such as bluestacks.  Personally I dislike the publisher so I'd do it.

reviewText:
Tippy tap thats the sound of an iPad screen, well what should be an iPad screen.

Sky to Fly faster than I can say the title of this game is a game that would be right at home on a mobile device (i'm pretty sure its on google play!). Though this version has increased graphical quality over its mobile counterpart. The two main controls are left and right and well thats about it what do you expect.

You're a pilot for a ship and your goal is to reach the end of the level and by golly there are things in the way! Floating islands, weird animals and the most difficult to get past enemy ships. When completing a level you get a star rating out of 3. This means that anyone who is kind of a completionist like myself will be replaying levels for that 3 star rating. Since your ships goes at about the same pace without powerups or other bonuses found on the map its a little weird having time" as one of the ratings in the ending screen.

You can change your ships crew giving you different bonuses which gives a small amount of customisation.
If you're a mobile enthusiast
date: temple run addict or anywhere in between you'll probably like this game. 7/10\n\nSky FTW is pretty neat
recommended: steampunk world with some silly characters and for $3.99 you can't really go wrong."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I didn't know what to expect when I first started this game, but after playing it for almost 2 hours, I can say I'm enjoying it so far.  The game has a beautiful art style to it, excellent soundtrack, and very easy to use controls.  It has that mobile port sort of feel in some places, but overall I recommend playing this game... especially if you enjoy casual gameplay.

Sure, the game is not all that difficult to play, nor is it all that expansive, but for an Early Access Game it runs perfectly fine and I think the developer has nailed the price point for a game like this.

I guess if I had some things I would change, it would be the graphic options.  Clearly the game looks great, but without having a full 1080p HD setting, it was sort of a let down.


If you are interested in seeing my thoughts as I played this game for the first time, here is my short First Look Video...
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cZ7hqIyAkJk

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This video features a non-biased quick look @ the game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k6L05i4gFf8

Dodge Sky Pirates and floating objects whilst collecting loot and power-ups in this charming steam punk runner. Sky to Fly: Faster Than Wind is a stunningly beautiful steampunk-themed runner about saving a sky-city from cruel pirates. Play on 20+ different levels, upgrade your ship and discover the mysteries of the malicious marauders.


This game lifts the veil on the wonderful world of Sky to Fly, where everything is out of the common run. It swings you to an alternative reality in which people had to abandon the solid earth buried under debris, for the islands floating high above. In the next three months we will give you an opportunity to engage in epic sky battles on a variety of airships, and in a year you may create your own civilization and challenge other members of the world of Sky to Fly. Meanwhile, enjoy 20 different levels in the Story mode and limitless missions from friends you are going to meet during the game, upgrade your ship and discover the mysteries of the malicious marauders. - Recommended!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sky To Fly Faster Than Wind is a decent Indie game for $3.99. The game takes place in a fantasy world and has a lot to offer than what it costs. https://youtu.be/ot7DQHYXcoY
Pros :
1) Beautiful graphics & epic levels.
2) In early access and still has a lot to offer.
3) Simple control and interface.
4) Clear and small introduction to everything new on your journey. (I liked the idea very much)
5) Smooth 60fps gameplay & responsive controls.
6) Nothing complicated.
7) Thoughtful and humourour dialogues.
Cons :
1) Not the best of stories as you would expect.
2) Adding the slowing down button would have been a better experience but that would hurt the flow of the game of course.
3) Adding a few more variations and a few more things to do will take the game to a whole new level. Like implementing
better one on one fights with pirates, a boss maybe or something else.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

How nice this game are!

At first glance,it can looks like a mobile game,because of their ui,but when you start to play you see that's not a ugly trash mobile port,is a beautiful pc game!

Gameplay Gameplay of this game is simple,since you need to control the plane with the W,A,S,D or arrow keys.
The game has 2 modes of playing it:
Missions - Here you complete the main missions of the game,with the instructions given,you need to go from A to B,not hard as well,but you need to take care with the enemies it can reduces your shield,and you don't win the 3 stars no damage on the end of level,some missions have a desired time to complete.
And the another mode you play the missions that you unlocked before to win more money to buy pilots.

Music
The sounds of the game are great,it has a calm and refreshing soundtrack,and the sound effects are ok to the game.

Positive Points
+ Game is cheap
+ Has much content to play
+ soundtrack is calm and relaxing

Negative Points
- Achievements are listed,but not working.

Overall
The game is cheap and if you are finding a simple game,that suits you.

Good fly!
